unit_learning_outcomes.description: apply fundamental concepts of data visualization to scientific datasets
clearly present scientific data and scripting results, and apply supporting evidence to evaluate underlying hypotheses
develop coding strategies to solve problems and evaluate ideas and information
manipulate and process scientific data using Matlab and Python scripts
demonstrate an understanding of basic computing algorithms, structures, and variables commonly used in scientific computing

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: working through the example scripts and material

assessments.description: A take-home exam will involve the visualization of a dataset using the techniques developed in the course, and a short report.
Use the basic elements of programming to solve some problems.
A 20-30 page report describing the methods and results of the data processing project. The report includes scientific figures and a full analysis of the chosen topic.
Use the concepts introduced in the Python module to solve a problem set

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Special circumstances

academic_org.value: Department of Earth and Environmental Sciences

data.description: In this hands-on, tutorial-style unit students will work with big data, learning how to manipulate, process and display large geoscience datasets using sophisticated scientific visualization programs. Topics covered include an introduction to programming using Matlab and Python, developing maps and processing digital elevation data, rendering and animation, managing and processing large datasets, algorithms in earth and environmental Science - including for statistical analysis and filtering, machine learning and clustering approaches, and visualisation of data. Students work through tutorial modules and also produce a final project using a dataset of their choosing. This unit is suitable for students at all levels of programming, and outside of Earth and Environmental Sciences, particularly those developing research skills using big data or geospatial analysis.
data.title: Scientific Visualisation and Scripting

description: In this hands-on, tutorial-style unit students will work with big data, learning how to manipulate, process and display large geoscience datasets using sophisticated scientific visualization programs. Topics covered include an introduction to programming using Matlab and Python, developing maps and processing digital elevation data, rendering and animation, managing and processing large datasets, algorithms in earth and environmental Science - including for statistical analysis and filtering, machine learning and clustering approaches, and visualisation of data. Students work through tutorial modules and also produce a final project using a dataset of their choosing. This unit is suitable for students at all levels of programming, and outside of Earth and Environmental Sciences, particularly those developing research skills using big data or geospatial analysis.
title: Scientific Visualisation and Scripting
